alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Chickasaw; Clayton; Fayette; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 9:48PM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Continue Tonight West of the Mississippi River... .White-out conditions continue to be reported west of the Mississippi. No travel advisories have been issued for northern Iowa. East of the Mississippi River, strong winds continue to result in localized drifting of snow over roadways and brief white-out conditions. Many county roads remain closed across Grant County. Wind chills remain bitterly cold with values of 30 to 35 degrees below zero. Frostbite can occur in as little as 30 minutes in these conditions. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Wind chill values of 30 to 35 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions.
